location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'MAP No. 1 ADMINISTRATIVE LAY-OUT IN PALESTINE OCTOBER 1936 PALESTINE Administration Map'

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: Printed in colour on paperDimensions: 800 x 530mm, on sheet 1015 x 618mm

mods.abstract: The map accompanies Military Lessons of the Arab Rebellion in Palestine, 1936, and shows the northern portion of Palestine, indicating hospitals, field ambulances, power stations, stores, ordnance depots, workshops, boundaries, roads, cities, towns, Arab villages, Jewish settlements and landing grounds. Three inset maps show the cities of Haifa, Jerusalem and Jaffa & Tel Aviv at a scale of 1:40,000.A legend appears in the bottom margin, alongside schematic diagrams which show supply and evacuation arrangements for vehicles, ordnance and the sick.The map was reprinted by the Survey of Palestine in 1939.
